intro: Anisomeris barbata, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has a woody stem and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting well to poor soil conditions and drought. Its foliage is typically gray-green, with hairy surfaces that help reduce water loss.
